page.title: 18Customs in Aith
page.content: {Kale casting.}Around Halloween children sometimes go kale casting. They wait until it is dark and then they go out and gather some kale (cabbages) from the fields, or sometimes turnips or peats. They creep quietly to someone's house and throw them in the front door and run off. {Guising.}At Christmas and at New Year children and adults go guising. They disguise themselves with old clothes and masks and go around the village knocking on doors. In each house the folk have to guess who the guisers are and masks aren't taken off until they guess correctly. Food and drink are offered in each house and sweets etc. for the children. Then the guisers move on to another house.
